result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. Skroch

defendant.name: Skroch, Michael L.
defendant.address: 1877 Whistling Straits Dr. Apt 206, Altoona, WI

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on February 20, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Karleigh Miller at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $50 beginning 06/18/2021 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

9:05 AM cases 21CF437 and 22CF244 called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael L. Skroch in court.  Attorney Karleigh K. Miller in court for Michael L. Skroch.  
In 21CF437: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
In 22CF244: Court orders county appointment of Attorney Miller. 
Defense to schedule a Status Conference with the branch 1 judicial assistant.

Conditions: 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances.

(Case called at 11:09 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Michael Skroch appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint. Defendant updates phone number. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Hearing: 03/28/2022 at 9:00 AM (Branch 1)

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances.
